data.title: Delicious sandwich
data.text: I will definitely go back to Downtown Central Perk.  The sandwich was great, and there are lots of interesting things to look at, craft soaps, scarves, earrings, etc.  I was happy to find a quiet place for a serious discussion with friends.

data.title: Good Food, Unfriendly Service
data.text: Ate here for the first time and thought the food was very good and offers several nice options for vegetarians. The only drawback is the one person that was working was not overly friendly and seemed annoyed with us more than anything. We payed with a debit card and she slid it on an iPad and then turned it around for me to sign, walking away to start our food. I thought this was odd, I am not familiar with their system and wasn't exactly sure what to do and it could have been considered as rude. While preparing the food this gal was talking to some guy that was in the kitchen with her discussing "having to do all this s%#$". The food was prepared in a timely manner. After our food was brought to us this girl walked out the door to go smoke a cigarette, leaving the restaurant completely unattended which I again thought odd. When she came back, I made a point of trying to strike up a conversation and told her the food was very good. She said thanks, took my son's plate and walked away. Shouldn't it be the staff initiating conversation and asking how the food is? I would really like to give them another chance as the food was good and my son loves finding vegetarian options. However, if we go back to the same kind of service it will be our last time. I have no tolerance for poor customer service, especially when we are the only patrons in the restaurant (was about 2 pm).

data.title: Eh.
data.text: Stopped by on the way to the office to grab a coffee. As the other reviewers said, the baristas are not overly friendly nor speedy. I impatiently waited in line with five other patrons for 10+ minutes for a single cup of coffee. Coffee was good, but nothing to write home about.

data.title: Okay but not outstanding
data.text: Heard a lot of hype about the place and my daughter and I wanted to check it out.   I found the staff to be a little unfriendly - not welcoming or what I would call professional.   the inside is a cozy mix of decor with a variety of seating options.  I like the feel of the place but the food is only average - I wasn't impressed.  Not sure if I would return - but perhaps we will one day give it a second chance if we are in the area.

data.title: Perfect hidden gem
data.text:
We stopped here for smoothies on the recommendation of a family member. this place is amazing! the food is simple but tasty, the drinks are wonderful and the service is great. the local artist showcases of items for purchase are lovely, the tables and seating are placed great without crowding. There is a board game/reading/music area near the back and there are even a couple of small tables for sitting outside! 

Don't miss stopping here!!

data.title: Not bad but I don't understand the hype.
data.text:
The two girls working the counter were mild mannered. Not necessarily rude but I could tell they didn't care. My black bean sandwich fell apart all over my plate. My girlfriend's salad was almost all lettuce. So, for what we got I would definitely call it over priced.

As we were eating the two employees were sitting down outside not paying any attention to the restaurant. A man had cash in hand ready to buy something but after standing there for ten minutes he left.

This place may be 'davenport good' but it is certainly not good in general.

data.title: Average tasting coffee
data.text: We stopped to grab a coffee and the place was dark and a little musty smelling.  We ordered Americano coffee's and they we meh tasting.  I wouldn't go back.

data.title: Better than average for the area
data.text: Good local, non-chain atmosphere.  They only brew Intelligentsia brand coffee which is really good!  But the barista could use a little work on their pour over skills.  Seemed like they dumped and forgot, not giving the brew the attention it needed really make a great cup.  Drink this brand a lot both at home and at coffee shops in Minneapolis.  Taste of this familiar coffee brand here reflected the attention given to the process.  Still nice to a trend towards pour overs and better coffees, getting away from chains and watery batch brews.  A few tweaks and this place could be really great.

data.title: Comfortable, friendly cafe!
data.text: Although the menu is fairly small, it was exactly what we were looking for - breakfast sandwiches, bagels, etc.  The breakfast burrito was very good - the favorite at our table!  Open egg & cheese bagel was ok.  Nothing special. The coffee was good & I really enjoyed my hot tea - huge tea bag, so it was very favorable!!!  We also enjoyed looking at what was for sale by local artists. We'll be back!!

data.title: A great find
data.text: Want a comfy atmosphere with healthy  nutritious yet tasty food, here is where to go. Vegetarians will be happy to see the choices they have. Their coffees are great. Close to many attractions in downtown Davenport.

data.title: Delicious vegetarian food! Great atmosphere
data.text: Went to lunch with a friend and ordered the mushroom sandwich with a side salad. So delicious and the atmosphere is eclectic and calm. Staff was kind and helpful. Highly recommend.

data.title: Yum
data.text: So happy to find this place on our last visit.  Delicious coffee with coconut milk for my coffee, smoothies and fantastic, healthy sounding breakfasts.  Fun gift shop with local artists as well

data.title: Cool, friendly espresso bar
data.text: This was a surprising discovery as we walked down the street in Davenport's kind of down-and-out area.  Downtown Central Perk has an unassuming storefront, but lots of goings-on and great food inside.  Spacious, eclectic Diner chic greets you as you walk around and find a spot to sit.  Order up your coffee drinks at the bar, but don't forget to peruse the great little menu of food.  Nice breakfast sandwiches with the homemade breads and friendly cashiers.  Lots of vegetarian/vegan options.  They also offer nighttime entertainment: open mike nights, etc. We stopped here several times for coffees and eats, but also bought some locally made soaps and souvenirs.  Great find in a strange little city.

data.title: Hipster Coffee House
data.text: Vegetarian and hipster favorites.  Everything is very politically correct.  Odd mix of people.  I got guacamole and was surprised at how huge the portion was.

data.title: Great Coffee and the soups are home made!
data.text:
Best cup of joe in town!  The soups are hand made and fantastic!
Great sound system, and a wonderful place to relax!

data.title: Unique Discovery
data.text: Was out wandering one evening, looking for a place to stop for a bite to eat and ran across the Central Perk.  Was disappointed that they didn't have any live music at the time, but it appears as though they periodically do.  I'm not one to seek out "vegetarian fare" however the egg salad sandwich, potato salad and hummus and chips I ate were quite good.  VERY good egg salad sandwich.

data.title: An Oasis
data.text: If have lost your mind, as I lost mine this weekend, you may end up in downtown Davenport for two  days or so.  Unless you want to go out in the evening, as in alcoholic beverages, you are out of luck.  This an oasis in the desert.  Healthy foods and ecletic abiance.

data.title: Beautiful with great service
data.text: Coffee was hot, service was friendly, and the atmosphere is vintage but also clean and friendly. Great business!

data.title: Coffee and breakfast, never disappointed!!
data.text: We've had coffee at Central Perk numerous times and the coffee has always been outstanding and consistent.  Very smooth and perfect and I'm really picky when it comes to coffee.  Two stays ago we decided to have breakfast there and it was way better than I even expected.  The bagel sandwich was crunch and flavorful and perfect.  I'm gluten free so it was awesome to be able to eat a piece of gluten free toast with my breakfast.  A treat I most never get while eating out for breakfast.  You also have to check out their gift store.  It has a little bit of everything and I always check out what is new.  I met a friend their to do some work on our website while my husband went and read a book.  You feel comfortable doing either there!!  Wifi worked perfectly.  A great spot in downtown Davenport.  If you're worried about parking there is usually a spot close plus some parking in the back.

data.title: Nice quiet place
data.text: The food is pretty good. Nice variety of food. I liked the options because some of them you don't see in other restaurants. The coffee drinks were good. Love the atmosphere. Nice place to hang out for a while.
